== Main Inclusion Report for telepath-gabble ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/e/empathy]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Empathy is slated to become the default instant messenger for Karmic
0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=empathy|no CVE entries]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=empathy|no Secunia history]]</nowiki>
** Does not use network directly (but talks to telepathy daemon which uses the network)
** Data processing done by telepathy daemon
** No known source code review performed
0. ''UI standards:''
** Translated strings, http://l10n.gnome.org/module/empathy/ for stats
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Low volume of <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/pkgreport.cgi?src=empathy|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>.
** <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/empathy/+bugs|Ubuntu bugs]]</nowiki>.
** <nowiki>[[https://bugs.gnome.org|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: 19 bugs open, none critical
** very responsive Upstream.
0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** Packaging system (cdbs)
0. ''Dependencies:''
** telepathy-glib <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReportTelepathyGlib|MIR]]</nowiki>
** telepathy-gabble <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReportTelepathyGabble|MIR]]</nowiki>
** telepathy-salut <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReportTelepathySalut|MIR]]</nowiki>
** telepathy-haze <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReportTelepathyHaze|MIR]]</nowiki>
** telepathy-idle <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReportTelepathyIdle|MIR]]</nowiki>
** telepathy-mission-control <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReportTelepathyMissionControl|MIR]]</nowiki>
** libtelepathy <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReport-LibTelepathy|MIR]]</nowiki>
** telepathy-farsight <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReport-TelepathyFarsight|MIR]]</nowiki>
** farsight2 <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReport-Farsight2|MIR]]</nowiki>
** libnice <nowiki>[[MainInclusionReport-LibNice|MIR]]</nowiki>
0. ''Maintenance:''
** How much maintenance is this package likely to need?  Very little, should just come from debian
